Key Match Events: Royce Lewis and Brooks Lee both hit two-run doubles in a 6-4 win over the Angels.
Willi Castro ended a 0-for-16 skid with an RBI single in the fourth inning.
Royce Lewis ended his 0-for-20 skid with a sixth-inning single.
Jordyn Adams hit a 419-foot solo homer off Jorge Alcala in the sixth inning.
Taylor Ward hit a 416-foot leadoff homer in the first inning.
Nolan Schanuel hit a 382-foot solo homer to right field in the third inning.
Griffin Jax pitched two hitless innings and fanned three.
Jhoan Duran closed out the game and picked up his 23rd save of the year.
Post-Match Reflections: Twins manager Rocco Baldelli commented on Royce Lewis' performance, saying 'It was a great swing. You can always feel Royce, when he feels good about what's going on, he gives off a lot — there's a lot of good energy coming off and that was one of those nice Royce moments.'
Baldelli also mentioned the strategy of using the bullpen early due to having a day off the next day.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game included a remembrance of the Sept. 11 attacks with a flyover of Target Field.
Griffin Jax's family, including his brother and sister-in-law, were part of the flyover.
